t: For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” Of David. A miktam. When he had fled from Saul into the cave.
Have*pn mercy on me, my God, have mercy on me, for*ld in you I take refuge. I*ln will take refuge in the shadow of your wings until*ld the disaster has passed.
I*pn cry out to God Most High, to*ld God, who vindicates me.
He*ln sends from heaven and saves me, rebuking*ld those who hotly pursue me— God*ld sends forth his love and his faithfulness.
I*pn am in the midst of lions; I*ld am forced to dwell among ravenous beasts— men*ln whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose*ld tongues are sharp swords.
Be*pn exalted, O God, above the heavens; let*ld your glory be over all the earth.
They*pn spread a net for my feet— I*ld was bowed down in distress. They*ln dug a pit in my path— but*ld they have fallen into it themselves.
My*pn heart, O God, is steadfast, my*ld heart is steadfast; I*ld will sing and make music.
Awake,*ln my soul! Awake,*ld harp and lyre! I*ld will awaken the dawn.
I*pn will praise you, Lord, among the nations; I*ld will sing of you among the peoples.
For*ln great is your love, reaching to the heavens; your*ld faithfulness reaches to the skies.
Be*pn exalted, O God, above the heavens; let*ld your glory be over all the earth.
